channel.title: Social Work on Behaviorism and Mental Health
channel.description: Recent content in Social Work on Behaviorism and Mental Health

item.title: The Dehumanizing Aspect of DSM
item.description:
In January 2014, the journal Research on Social Work Practice published a special issue: A Critical Appraisal of the DSM-5: Social Work Perspectives.Â  There were many excellent articles in this volume, some of which I have highlighted in earlier posts.

One of the very outstanding articles is The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders as a Major Form of Dehumanization in the Modern World, by Eileen Gambrill, PhD, a graduate school Professor at the School of Social Welfare, University of California, Berkeley.
